' online privacy. When Larry Page and Co-founder Sergey Brin started Google, they envisioned a company that was more socially conscious and responsive than most corporations. That outlook was famously expressed by Google's unofficial motto, Don't be evil. Over the past decade, under Eric Schmidt 's leadership, the company has all too often paid only lip service to the sentiment, Consumer Watchdog said.
